books.author: by David Sedaris
books.description: The humorist portrays personal and public upheavals of his life in its seventh decade and the world in the time of a pandemic.
books.name: HAPPY-GO-LUCKY

books.author: by Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard
books.description: The 11th book in the conservative commentator’s Killing series gives an account of the global war against terrorists.
books.name: KILLING THE KILLERS

books.author: by Viola Davis
books.description: The multiple award-winning actress describes the difficulties she encountered before claiming her sense of self and achieving professional success.
books.name: FINDING ME

books.author: by Bessel van der Kolk
books.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.
books.name: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE

books.author: by Kellyanne Conway
books.description: The former senior counselor in President Trump’s White House gives her account of her time in politics.
books.name: HERE'S THE DEAL

books.author: edited by Nikole Hannah-Jones, Caitlin Roper, Ilena Silverman and Jake Silverstein
books.description: Viewing America’s entanglement with slavery and its legacy, in essays adapted and expanded from The New York Times Magazine.
books.name: THE 1619 PROJECT

books.author: by Tina Brown
books.description: This follow-up to “The Diana Chronicles” details how the royal family reinvented itself after the death of Princess Diana.
books.name: THE PALACE PAPERS

books.author: by Michelle Zauner
books.description: The daughter of a Korean mother and Jewish-American father, and leader of the indie rock project Japanese Breakfast, describes creating her own identity after losing her mother to cancer.
books.name: CRYING IN H MART

books.author: by Alan Shipnuck
books.description: An unauthorized biography of the golf champion Phil Mickelson.
books.name: PHIL

books.author: by James Kirchick
books.description: How cultural and political anxiety over gay people affected presidential administrations during the 20th century and created a decades-long witch hunt.
books.name: SECRET CITY

books.author: by Jon Krakauer
books.description: Two brothers who subscribed to a fundamentalist version of Mormonism killed a woman and her daughter; the basis of the TV series.
books.name: UNDER THE BANNER OF HEAVEN

books.author: by Robin Wall Kimmerer
books.description: A botanist and member of the Citizen Potawatomi Nation espouses having an understanding and appreciation of plants and animals.
books.name: BRAIDING SWEETGRASS

books.author: by Candice Millard
books.description: The story of the hardships encountered during 19th-century expeditions in Africa, and the complicated partnerships behind them.
books.name: RIVER OF THE GODS

books.author: by Jenna Fischer and Angela Kinsey
books.description: Two stars of “The Office” celebrate the comedy series and their friendship.
books.name: THE OFFICE BFFS

books.author: by bell hooks
books.description: The late feminist icon explores the causes of a polarized society and the meaning of love.
books.name: ALL ABOUT LOVE
